titleStmt.title: Lilburns ghost, with a whip in one hand, to scourge tyrants out of authority; and balme in the other, to heal the sores of our (as yet) corrupt state; or, Some of the late dying principles of freedom, revived, and unvailed, for the lovers of freedome and liberty, peace & righteousness to behold. By one who desires no longer to live then to serve his country

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Livewell Chapman, at the Crown in Popes-Head-Alley,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
